name: libstatgrab
description: Provides cross-platform access to statistics about the system

repo.name: libstatgrab
repo.description: A cross platform library for accessing system statistics

readme.summary: This README focuses entirely on building/contributing to the project but never explains what libstatgrab actually does or how to use it.
readme.top_issue: No description of what the library does, what problems it solves, or any usage examples - users cannot understand the purpose within 30 seconds

injection_risks.description: Use of sscanf() with user-controlled input from /proc/stat, but the format string is fixed and does not contain any format specifiers that could lead to buffer overflows or other injection attacks.
Use of sscanf() with user-controlled input from /proc/stat, but the format string is fixed and does not contain any format specifiers that could lead to buffer overflows or other injection attacks.
Use of sscanf() with user-controlled input from /proc/stat, but the format string is fixed and does not contain any format specifiers that could lead to buffer overflows or other injection attacks.
Use of sscanf() with user-controlled input from /proc/stat, but the format string is fixed and does not contain any format specifiers that could lead to buffer overflows or other injection attacks.

critical_findings: Potential NULL pointer dereference in sg_get_cpu_stats_int()
Lack of bounds checking on array indices
security.summary: The code has some minor security concerns, including potential NULL pointer dereferences and lack of bounds checking, but overall it appears to be well-structured and secure.

common_complaints: Build failures with modern autoconf versions
Compatibility issues with newer Linux kernels and FreeBSD versions
sentiment.summary: libstatgrab shows clear signs of abandonment with no releases in 2+ years, unaddressed critical bugs including segfaults, and multiple unresolved issues indicating the maintainer is no longer actively supporting the project.

red_flags: Some responses are brief and lack detail
There's a mix of technical depth and surface-level explanations
communication.summary: The maintainer responses are generally helpful but could benefit from more detailed explanations and encouragement for new contributors.

concerns: No commits for over 2 years (since September 2023)
No active contributors in the past 6 months
No merged pull requests in the past 6 months
No closed issues in the past 6 months despite 36 open issues
positive_signals: Repository still exists and is accessible
maintenance.summary: libstatgrab shows clear signs of abandonment with no development activity for over 2 years, unresolved issues, and no active maintainers.

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is somewhat clear and provides installation instructions, but lacks examples and a quick start guide.
concerns: No commits in the past six months
Docs: Lack of a quick start guide and examples for common use cases
Communication: Some responses are brief and lack detail
Communication: There's a mix of technical depth and surface-level explanations
Security: Potential NULL pointer dereference in sg_get_cpu_stats_int()
Security: Lack of bounds checking on array indices
highlights: Seven contributors active in the past six months
